data.title: Congressional District 2, ID
data.meta_description: In 2022, Congressional District 2, ID had a population of 923k people with a median age of 34.9 and a median household income of $68,629. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Congressional District 2, ID grew from 870,200 to 922,606, a 6.02% increase and its median household income grew from $61,601 to $68,629, a 11.4% increase.
data.text:
In 2022, Congressional District 2, ID had a population of 923k people with a median age of 34.9 and a median household income of $68,629. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Congressional District 2, ID grew from 870,200 to 922,606, a 6.02% increase and its median household income grew from $61,601 to $68,629, a 11.4% increase.

Most people in Congressional District 2, ID drove alone to work, and the average commute time was 19.8 minutes. The average car ownership in Congressional District 2, ID was 2 cars per household.

Congressional District 2, ID is home to a population of 923k people, from which 96.2% are citizens. As of 2022, 6.64% of Congressional District 2, ID residents were born outside of the country (61.3k people).

In 2022, there were 14.1 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (728k people) in Congressional District 2, ID than any other race or ethnicity. There were 51.8k White (Hispanic) and 39.6k Other (Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

The most common non-English languages spoken as the primary langauge in households in Congressional District 2, ID are Spanish (80,477 households), Chinese (Incl. Mandarin, Cantonese) (2,717 households), and Arabic (2,135 households).

As of 2022, 96.2% of Congressional District 2, ID residents were US citizens, which is higher than the national average of 93.5%. In 2021, the percentage of US citizens in Congressional District 2, ID was 96%, meaning that the rate of citizenship has been increasing.

The following chart shows US citizenship percentages in Congressional District 2, ID compared to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

In 2022, there were 14.1 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (728k people) in Congressional District 2, ID than any other race or ethnicity. There were 51.8k White (Hispanic) and 39.6k Other (Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

14.3% of the people in Congressional District 2, ID are hispanic (132k people).

The following chart shows the 7 races represented in Congressional District 2, ID as a share of the total population.

As of 2022, 6.64% of Congressional District 2, ID residents (61.3k people) were born outside of the United States, which is lower than the national average of 13.6%. In 2021, the percentage of foreign-born citizens in Congressional District 2, ID was 6.74%, meaning that the rate has been decreasing.

The following chart shows the percentage of foreign-born residents in Congressional District 2, ID compared to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

12.3% of the households in Congressional District 2, ID reported speaking a non-English language at home as their primary shared language, which is lower than the national average of 21.7%. This does not consider the potential multi-lingual nature of households, but only the primary self-reported language spoken by all members of the household.

In 2022, the most common non-English language spoken in households in Congressional District 2, ID was Spanish. 9.31% of the households in Congressional District 2, ID reported speaking Spanish at home as the primary shared language between all members living in the household.

The economy of Congressional District 2, ID employs 445k people. The largest industries in Congressional District 2, ID are Health Care & Social Assistance (59,508 people), Retail Trade (50,257 people), and Manufacturing (43,087 people), and the highest paying industries are Utilities ($84,688), Mining, Quarrying, & Oil & Gas Extraction ($75,667), and Professional, Scientific, & Technical Services ($66,228).

From 2021 to 2022, employment in Congressional District 2, ID grew at a rate of 7.25%, from 415k employees to 445k employees.

The most common job groups, by number of people living in Congressional District 2, ID, are Management Occupations (49,144 people), Office & Administrative Support Occupations (46,928 people), and Sales & Related Occupations (41,287 people). This chart illustrates the share breakdown of the primary jobs held by residents of Congressional District 2, ID.

From 2021 to 2022, employment in Congressional District 2, ID grew at a rate of 7.25%, from 415k employees to 445k employees.

The most common employment sectors for those who live in Congressional District 2, ID, are Health Care & Social Assistance (59,508 people), Retail Trade (50,257 people), and Manufacturing (43,087 people). This chart shows the share breakdown of the primary industries for residents of Congressional District 2, ID, though some of these residents may live in Congressional District 2, ID and work somewhere else. Census data is tagged to a residential address, not a work address.

As of February 2023, there are 836k people employed in Idaho. This represents a 3.01% increase in employment when compared to February 2022.

Right after the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, during April 2020, a general dip can be seen across industry sectors, resulting in an overall decline in employment by 8.06%.

The following chart shows monthly employment numbers for each industry sector in Idaho.

In the 2020 presidential election, the popular vote in Idaho went to Donald J. Trump with 63.8% of the vote. The runner-up was Joseph R Biden Jr. (33.1%), followed by Jo Jorgensen (1.89%).

Mike Crapo and Jim Risch are the senators currently representing the state of Idaho. In the United States, senators are elected to 6-year terms with the terms for individual senators staggered.

Congressional District 2, ID is currently represented by Mike Simpson in the U.S. house, and members of the House of Representives are elected to 2-year terms.

The median property value in Congressional District 2, ID was $301,800 in 2022, which is 1.07 times larger than the national average of $281,900. Between 2021 and 2022 the median property value increased from $239,500 to $301,800, a 26% increase. The homeownership rate in Congressional District 2, ID is 68.4%, which is approximately the same as the national average of 64.8%.

People in Congressional District 2, ID have an average commute time of 19.8 minutes, and they drove alone to work. Car ownership in Congressional District 2, ID is approximately the same as the national average, with an average of 2 cars per household.

In 2022, the median household income of the 335k households in Congressional District 2, ID grew to $68,629 from the previous year's value of $61,601.

The following chart displays the households in Congressional District 2, ID distributed between a series of income buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households have an income in the $75k - $100k range.

In 2022, 74.3% of workers in Congressional District 2, ID drove alone to work, followed by those who worked at home (10.4%) and those who carpooled to work (9.21%).

The following chart shows the number of households using each mode of transportation over time, using a logarithmic scale on the y-axis to help better show variations in the smaller means of commuting.

Using averages, employees in Congressional District 2, ID have a shorter commute time (19.8 minutes) than the normal US worker (26.7 minutes). Additionally, 1.92% of the workforce in Congressional District 2, ID have "super commutes" in excess of 90 minutes.

The chart below shows how the median household income in Congressional District 2, ID compares to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

12.1% of the population for whom poverty status is determined in Congressional District 2, ID (108k out of 899k people) live below the poverty line, a number that is lower than the national average of 12.5%. The largest demographic living in poverty are Females 18 - 24, followed by Males 18 - 24 and then Females 25 - 34.

The most common racial or ethnic group living below the poverty line in Congressional District 2, ID is White, followed by Hispanic and Two Or More.

The Census Bureau uses a set of money income thresholds that vary by family size and composition to determine who classifies as impoverished. If a family's total income is less than the family's threshold than that family and every individual in it is considered to be living in poverty.

In 2022, insured persons according to age ranges were distributed in 27.4% under 18 years, 22.9% between 18 and 34 years, 35% between 35 and 64 years, and 14.7% over 64 years.

By gender, of the total number of insured persons, 49.5% were men and 50.5% were women.

The following chart shows the number of people with health coverage by gender.
